contentList.title: Why Inflation Battered Argentinians Are Turning To Crypto
contentList.description: A Forbes analysis found the country, with a 276% inflation rate, has the highest crypto adoption rate in the Western Hemisphere, but little use of the most trustworthy exchanges.

contentList.title: Por Qué Los Argentinos Golpeados Por La Inflación Están Recurriendo A Las Criptomonedas
contentList.description: Un análisis de Forbes encontró que el país, el cual tiene una inflación del 276%, tiene la tasa de adopción de criptomonedas más alta del hemisferio occidental, pero poco uso de las plataformas de criptomonedas más confiables.

contentList.title: Why These Bitcoin Miners Are Becoming Summer’s Hot AI Stocks
contentList.description: Crypto miners are harnessing their advanced equipment and low-cost energy for the burgeoning artificial intelligence sector. As the demand for computational power soars, these miners are uniquely positioned to profit from the AI boom.

contentList.title: Solana-Focused Fund Raises $60 Million With Promise Of Hackathon Insight
contentList.description: The fund is run by Colosseum, a company that took over Solana’s hackathon program and will make early-stage investments in select winners of the six-week competitions ...

contentList.title: MtGox $9 Billion Payout Is Creditors’ Gain But Bitcoin’s Pain
contentList.description: Exchange that failed in 2014 is finally returning funds to customers. Some investors fear a flood of bitcoin and bitcoin cash will destabilize the market, but others say it is an isolated event with limited long-term effect.

contentList.title: How Crypto’s Richest Billionaire Doubled His Net Worth Behind Bars
contentList.description: Binance’s founder, known to crypto followers as CZ,  is spending the summer in Santa Barbara’s Lompoc minimum security prison. As crypto markets climb, Forbes reveals the secretive source of his ballooning billions.

contentList.title: Bitcoin Miner Core Scientific’s Stock Soars On AI Expansion Plans
contentList.description: The hunt for available data-center space is driving AI companies to purchase capacity from cryptocurrency miners, which possess the required hardware and are seeking more profitable applications for it.

contentList.title: Why FTX’s Generous Bankruptcy Payouts Still Leave Some Creditors Cold
contentList.description: Despite the collapsed crypto exchange's claim of recovering enough funds to pay back most creditors, some former customers argue they’re being left in the lurch.

contentList.title: This Crypto Billionaire’s Fund Could Reap More Than $1 Billion From The FTX Bankruptcy
contentList.description: While one part of his firm was advising on asset sales, traders at Mike Novogratz’s Galaxy Digital bought a hoard of Solana tokens at a steep discount from bankrupt crypto exchange FTX. Windfall profits are likely.

contentList.title: ‘Elizabeth Warren’s Anti-Crypto Wing Is A Shrinking Iceberg’, Says Former Top Regulator
contentList.description: Former CFTC Chairman Christopher Giancarlo believes that momentum on pro-crypto legislation in the U.S. is making an outcast of Senator Elizabeth Warren and other lawmakers opposed to the industry.

contentList.title: SEC Stunner: Ether ETFs Are A Go
contentList.description: Regulator approves exchange requests to list spot ether funds tracking the price of the $458 billion asset. But trading won’t start right away.

contentList.title: House To Vote On Who Will Regulate Crypto
contentList.description: Bill Would Put Tokens Of Centralized Blockchains Under The SEC While The Rest Go To The CFTC.

contentList.title: The World’s Most Trustworthy Crypto Exchanges And Marketplaces
contentList.description: After years of turbulence, including jail time for the founders of the two biggest cryptocurrency exchanges, many providers are getting serious about controls and regulation. Coinbase leads our list of the 20 most trustworthy marketplaces in an industry that still requires caution.

contentList.title: It’s Disclosure Time For Hedge Funds: What Bitcoiners Should Know
contentList.description: It’s the inaugural 13F season for Bitcoin ETFs, but not all filings are created equal. Here’s a guide for deciphering bullish bets from background noise.

contentList.title: How Crypto Giant Tether’s New CEO Is Remaking The Company For The Apocalypse
contentList.description: With $111 billion in assets and $6 billion in profits, shadowy stablecoin merchant Tether has emerged as crypto’s most profitable company. Now it's restructuring, moving into bitcoin mining, AI and education.

contentList.title: Bitcoin Mining Profitability Hits An All Time Low, But Here’s Who Is Still Thriving
contentList.description: Bitcoin’s fierce rise has inspired a search for how to invest in it beyond just buying the ETF and holding it. Buyer beware.

contentList.title: Former Top SEC Litigator Says ‘There’s No Systematic Plan To Kill Crypto’
contentList.description: Ladan Stewart heard all of the industry’s criticism as led cases against Ripple, Coinbase, and many others. Now in the private sector she wants to find common ground between crypto and the SEC.

contentList.title: Consensys Suit Is Pressing The SEC On Ether’s Security Status
contentList.description: MetaMask maker goes on offense following the warning of an impending enforcement action. The SEC says most cryptos are securities but has not clearly stated its position on ether.

contentList.title: U.S. Stablecoin Bill Would Rein In Tether, Boost Coinbase And Circle, Outlaw Algorithmics
contentList.description: Bitcoin’s fierce rise has inspired a search for how to invest in it beyond just buying the ETF and holding it. Buyer beware.

contentList.title: The New IRS Crypto Form Brings Hidden Challenges For Taxpayers
contentList.description: Form 1099-DA is meant to help the IRS identify tax dodgers. Its implementation next year could create complications.

contentList.title: Anchorage Digital Bank Launches Global Settlement Network For Digital Assets
contentList.description: The San Francisco crypto custodian wants to make it easy for institutional clients to transfer their funds without compromising security.

contentList.title: IRS Releases Draft Of New Crypto Tax Form Used To Report  Transactions
contentList.description: The IRS has released a draft of Form 1099-DA. The form is the next step in efforts to bolster crypto tax reporting and follows proposed regulations published last year.

contentList.title: A Crypto Winter Survivor Plots A Comeback Targeting Big Ticket Investors
contentList.description: California-based crypto investment platform Abra outlasted the 2022 bloodbath despite shutting down its U.S. retail business. It is now pivoting to institutions and wealthy private clients seeking alternative crypto exposure.

contentList.title: Best Buys For The Bitcoin Halving
contentList.description: Bitcoin is up 44% so far this year. Its halving could accelerate this trend and spread the gains to other stocks and tokens. Some crypto miners may face a difficult road ahead.

contentList.title: Investors Pile Into 2X Leveraged ETFs Before The Bitcoin Halving
contentList.description: In the run-up to the fourth bitcoin halving on April 19th, a little known bitcoin futures ETF rode a 135% return in Q1, double that of spot bitcoin ETFs..

contentList.title: Former IRS Crime Chief Finds New Home At Fintech Firm Chainalysis
contentList.description: Former IRS-CI Chief Jim Lee has announced that he was joining Chainalysis as their Global Head of Capacity Building.

contentList.title: How A Bitcoin Supply Crunch Could Push The Price To $100,000
contentList.description: Bitcoin’s imminent halving is coinciding with unprecedented demands from new ETFs from firms like Blackrock and Fidelity. Analysts think it could lead to explosive growth for the asset through the end of 2024.

contentList.title: Use Caution Before Investing In Bitcoin Side Projects
contentList.description: Bitcoin’s fierce rise has inspired a search for how to invest in it beyond just buying the ETF and holding it. Buyer beware.

contentList.title: Ripple's Move Into Stablecoins Raises Key Questions For XRP’s Future
contentList.description: The San Francisco firm announced plans to enter the lucrative digital dollar market, dominated by stablecoin giants Tether and Circle. Will this weaken demand for the $32 billion market cap XRP?

contentList.title: Ethereum’s Newest ETF Applicant Wants The SEC To Delay Approvals Until  December
contentList.description: Bitwise CIO Matt Hougan argues that the asset management industry is too focused on bitcoin products to provide ether ETFs the necessary attention to thrive.

contentList.title: How $30 Plushy Penguins Helped An NFT Company Survive Crypto Winter
contentList.description: Move over Bored Apes. Thanks to a contract with Walmart to sell stuffed toy versions of its cute aquatic birds,The Igloo Co is home to the world’s hottest NFT collection.

contentList.title: The Rise Of Crypto’s Billion Dollar Zombies
contentList.description: With bitcoin soaring once again, blockchains are suddenly much more valuable. More than 50 of them are now worth over $1 billion—despite many having few users.

contentList.title: Deciphering When To Buy And Sell Your Bitcoin
contentList.description: As volatile as ever, bitcoin is hitting new highs. But how can you tell the difference between normal trading and major bull or bear moves?

contentList.title: Examining Block With Bitcoin In Mind
contentList.description: Block had record bitcoin profits last quarter, thanks to cost-cutting and a growing payments business. Block is an option for equities investors seeking crypto exposure.

contentList.title: Bitcoin Is Skyrocketing. Now Traders Are Looking At These Altcoins
contentList.description: Bitcoin is trading near new highs. Should investors buy into other cryptocurrencies known as altcoins?

contentList.title: Beleaguered Bakkt Completes $38 Million Direct Offering
contentList.description: The fundraise comes after dire warnings of insolvency at Wall Street’s once-hot crypto infrastructure play.

contentList.title: This Crypto Venture Capitalist  Is Bullish On Modular Blockchains, But Cautious About Restaking
contentList.description: In this discussion we look past the groundswell of excitement surrounding the spot bitcoin ETFs and dive into key emerging topics in the industry like liquid restaking and modular blockchains. We also cover why Gupta expects us to enter into another DeFi boom.

contentList.title: Why Bitcoin’s Surge Could Be A Boon, Or Trap, For New Ether ETFs
contentList.description: The crypto industry has long resisted having its tokens classified as securities. However, the success of bitcoin’s spot ETFs, could prompt issuers like BlackRock and Fidelity to break ranks in order to comply with the SEC’s gameplan.

contentList.title: Bitmain-Backed Crypto Miner Bitfufu Finally Goes Public In SPAC Deal
contentList.description: The Singapore-based crypto mining platform’s debut on the Nasdaq comes as bitcoin is closing in on its all-time high of almost $69,000.

contentList.title: Questions Linger From A Crypto Exchange’s Rare Bull Market Meltdown
contentList.description: The exchange, whose founder and CEO resigned three weeks ago, has gone dark just as bitcoin climbs toward its November 2021 all-time high of $69,000.

contentList.title: Crypto Billionaire Mike Novogratz On Bitcoin’s Next Bull Run
contentList.description: Former hedge fund star and unabashed digital asset evangelist, Mike Novogratz, believes traditional finance will drive bitcoin’s next evolution. He also rails against outdated regulations, Baby Boomers and America’s obesity problem.

contentList.title: This Crypto Darling Burned Through $2 Billion. Here’s Its Survival Strategy
contentList.description: Wall Street’s leading crypto infrastructure firm, Bakkt, has struggled to lock onto a viable product offering, and recently warned stockholders that it might not survive. Another pivot is underway.

contentList.title: Kraken Echoes Coinbase And Binance In Motion To Dismiss SEC Suit
contentList.description: Digital exchange claims cryptos are not securities and that the agency is going beyond its mandate.

contentList.title: What Is The Future Of Bitcoin Futures?
contentList.description: Spot bitcoin ETFs are finally here, attracting billions and challenging all pre-existing crypto-based ETFs. Does that spell the end for bitcoin futures funds? Not so fast. ProShares is doubling down.

contentList.title: As Bitcoin ETFs Take Center Stage, Coinbase Diversifies
contentList.description: The exchange became an industry darling by offering a user-friendly product and promising to adhere to regulations. Now, new low-fee bitcoin funds are eating into its lucrative transaction fee business.

contentList.title: Ethereum Tokens Put On Notice By Dencun Hard Fork
contentList.description: Ethereum is about to undergo a major scalability update that could make the value proposition for its so-called Layer 2  blockchains obsolete. However, some tokens will likely continue to thrive.

contentList.title: Bitcoin Passes $50,000 Amid Growing ETF Momentum
contentList.description: Bitcoin crossed the $50,000 mark for the first time since the bullish days of 2021.

contentList.title: Hong Kong Startup Raises $6.85 Million Series A For Blockchain-Powered Insurance Claims
contentList.description: With over 1 million policyholders and 16 insurance companies assisted, MediConCen says it plans to expand into the Middle East and Southeast Asia.

contentList.title: Bulking Up For Bitcoin’s Halving, Miners Sold $1.6 Billion In Stock In 2023
contentList.description: Bitcoin miners are about to see their revenues cut by the bitcoin halving. Publicly traded firms used last year’s bull run to raise capital before April's supply shock.

contentList.title: Exposing The Myth Of Decentralization
contentList.description: Never mind the recent crypto rally, for a decade the industry has been selling the promise of decentralization, a new financial system without middlemen, but many blockchain projects have recreated the very system they tried to overthrow and regulators are adamant about keeping the status quo.

contentList.title: A16z’s Chris Dixon Believes Crypto Will Unseat The Magnificant Seven
contentList.description: In his new book, Dixon argues that firms such as Alphabet, Meta, and others have reaped monopolistic profits for too long. While crypto may not be ready to overthrow these firms, he says it is only a matter of time.

contentList.title: GBTC’s New Bitcoin ETF Lost More Than $1 Billion.  Rivals Like Blackrock And Fidelity Are Gaining
contentList.description: After a week of trading, digital assets have begun flowing from Grayscale’s flagship bitcoin ETF, while its TradFi rivals gain share. Here’s an analysis.

contentList.title: Hong Kong Crypto Exchange Hashkey Hits Unicorn Status With $100 Million Funding Round
contentList.description: Hashkey is now valued at more than $1.2 billion after pulling in capital from OKX Ventures and others, according to sources.

contentList.title: Student Lender Sofi’s Growth Story Leaves Unanswered Questions
contentList.description: Thirteen years after its founding, the $2 billion consumer lender’s executives are buzzing about its growth and profitability, but its SEC filing tells a different tale.

contentList.title: Bitcoin ETF Scorecard: Grayscale Tops Trading Volume But How Much Were Redemptions?
contentList.description: The race is on to gather assets via traditional financial firms into Satoshi’s brainchild, bitcoin. After a day of trading GBTC, Fidelity and Blackrock see the biggest volume. .

contentList.title: Banks Bitcoin Futures Bets Jump Into The Billions In Anticipation Of ETF
contentList.description: Banks have grown their overall exposure to the price of bitcoin by 800% since the end of 2020 according to data from the CFTC, th...

contentList.title: Did FTX Secretly Help Binance Send Tokens To Binance.US For Wash Trading?
contentList.description: The SEC’s case accuses Binance of wash trading. A Forbes investigation reveals that FTX may have been an important middleman.

contentList.title: The Prospect Of ETFs Could Bring A Bitcoin Santa Rally
contentList.description: You better watch out. Satoshi could be coming to town because when bitcoin jumps during the last week in December it tends to soar.

contentList.title: Will Former NYSE Boss Tom Farley Be The Next Crypto King?
contentList.description: He left the NYSE for SPAC riches, then pivoted to crypto just before the market peaked. Now Tom Farley's running the crypto exchange his SPAC failed to buy, and scooping up distressed digital assets.

contentList.title: Bitcoin Mining Stocks Soar As Firms Race To Buy New Hardware Before The Halving
contentList.description: As bitcoin continues its bullish run, the first orders are in for next-generation mining rigs that offer unprecedented levels of power and energy efficiency. Here’s how to play the arms race as the April halving approaches.

contentList.title: Are DeFi’s High Yields On Stablecoins Worth The Risk?
contentList.description: As the crypto markets recover, yields on stablecoins across DeFi have surged to as much as 10%. Buyer beware.

contentList.title: How Investors Should Play The Upcoming Bitcoin Halving
contentList.description: Every four years bitcoin's issuance rate drops by 50%. In the past it’s been followed by bullish runs. Here’s how to maximize your gains.

contentList.title: A Fintech Titan In Community Banker’s Clothing
contentList.description: Already a force to be reckoned with in Silicon Valley, once-and-future billionaire Jackie Reses is out to disrupt financial services with a 95-year-old Missouri bank—without disturbing federal regulators.

contentList.title: How Investors Should Approach Bitcoin Miners As The Halving Draws Near
contentList.description: Miners have had a great year after a disastrous 2022, and the next supply reduction for bitcoin in 2024 could be even more bullish.

contentList.title: Why SBF’s Favorite Crypto, Solana, Has Doubled Since September
contentList.description: Having impressed the FTX brain trust, tokens for this Ethereum rival were concentrated in the wrong portfolio at the wrong time. But the technology that won over Bankman-Fried is impressing investors anew.

contentList.title: FTX Customers Should Recoup Most Of Their Losses, Unless IRS Bigfoots Them
contentList.description: There are many moving parts to the FTX bankruptcy, but exchange customers, especially small ones, stand to reclaim most of their lost assets if the U.S. government does not elbow them out of the way.

contentList.title: Why Tokenization Is Failing
contentList.description: Proponents of crypto tokenization have long boasted that it is a killer app for financial services. So why after nearly a decade and top tier backers like Goldman Sachs to McKinsey and, hasn’t it gained any traction.

contentList.title: Bitcoin Stocks Rally As ETF Prospects Lead To Crypto Short Squeeze
contentList.description: First digital asset again worth more than all the rest combined. Bitcoin-related equities join advance.

contentList.title: Are FTX’s Bankruptcy Claims A Screaming Bargain?
contentList.description: FTX’s debt has soared in the last few months but still sells at less than 50% of par value.  Look carefully before you leap.

contentList.title: Grayscale’s Crypto Fund Discounts Extend Far Beyond Bitcoin
contentList.description: The world’s largest digital asset manager offers 17 products tracking ether, bitcoin cash, chainlink, and many others that trade far away from the value of their underlying collateral. Should investors see them as trading opportunities?

contentList.title: Bitcoin Bears Could Come Out After Expected Fed Rate Freeze
contentList.description: Bitcoin has tended to bounce following rate announcements, even hikes, but they have shown not to last.

contentList.title: Requiem For Royalties: NFT Exchanges Abandon Recurring Compensation For Artists
contentList.description: OpenSea, once the leading marketplace for non-fungible tokens, was built on a promise of royalties to digital artists each time their works were resold. Then came upstart Blur, whose no-fee, trader oriented platform put the focus on pricing and costs.

contentList.title: You Can Buy Bitcoin At A Discount, If You Trust The SEC To Be Rational
contentList.description: The clock is ticking on a limited-time offer to get bitcoin on the cheap. Whether it turns out to be a bargain depends on the actions of an intransigent regulator.

contentList.title: How To Get Rich In Crypto: Four Tether Executives Are Now Billionaires
contentList.description: Members of the secretive management team behind $83 billion Tether stablecoin have literally minted their own fortunes.

contentList.title: This Startup Wants To Deanonymize Blockchain. Privacy Advocates Are Furious.
contentList.description: Arkham Intelligence has created a marketplace that allows people to buy and sell blockchain data. That’s bad news for the anonymity-loving world of cryptocurrencies.

contentList.title: Inside Binance’s Botched Efforts To Outwit Regulators In Europe
contentList.description: After failing to set up in the U.K., Binance built a lucrative payments business called Bifinity in Lithuania. Now its leading executives are being accused of fraud.

contentList.title: Making A Move On Ethereum
contentList.description: Despite tens of billions raised and lost in the name of disruptive crypto innovations, the alternative technology has yet to produce a breakthrough product, even in video gaming. Mysten Labs’ CEO says that’s because nobody’s done it right yet.

contentList.title: Satoshi Or Not, Here He Comes
contentList.description: It may not matter if Craig Wright created Bitcoin. The real question is whether the nearly 4,000 patents he controls or has pending will force computer programmers around the world to stop using open-source software as they now do—or pay up.

contentList.title: SEC Suits Say Nearly 70 Cryptos Are Securities But Proving It Will Be Difficult
contentList.description: When the SEC targeted Binance and Coinbase in lawsuits, the fallout cost more than a dozen of cryptos about $5 billion in market value. Some believe stablecoins and DeFi could be next.

contentList.title: What Japan Could Teach The U.S.—And The World—About Regulating Crypto
contentList.description: After the MtGox hack, Tokyo put in place tough rules that later protected FTX customers. Now, from that secure base, it’s moving to allow blockchain technologies to flourish.

contentList.title: Beware Of Flatcoins, Crypto’s Inflation Busting Fad
contentList.description: These coins are designed to protect stablecoin holders from inflation. But they are complicated and it’s not clear whether they will actually work.

contentList.title: Liquid Staking: Crypto’s New Phantom Money Machine
contentList.description: Coinbase, Binance and other exchanges hold at least $2.25 billion of shadow ether, as the latest lucrative innovation in digital assets ramps up.

contentList.title: Jack Dorsey-Backed Decentralized Twitter Rival Prepares To Launch With One Million Users
contentList.description: Billionaire Jack Dorsey hand selected Jay Graber to create  a social network that would let Twitter users own their own identities. Elon Musk won’t play along, but he has sparked a user exodus that offers her an opening.

contentList.title: Forget Art, Let’s Trade: How A 10-Person Startup Came To Dominate NFT Markets
contentList.description: While NFT sales declined over the past year, a new trader-focused NFT marketplace quietly dethroned OpenSea as market leader.

contentList.title: SVB Collapse Exposes Stablecoin Cracks, Regulation Likely For $100 Billion Industry
contentList.description: Circle’s USD Coin ballooned to $55 billion because institutional investors trust it more than Tether. Then SVB collapsed holding billions of USDC’s reserves and breaking the digital dollar.  Finally, stablecoin regulation is coming.

contentList.title: Legal Money Laundering: How A German Bank Is Cleaning Tainted Bitcoin And Other Dirty Cryptos
contentList.description: Blacklisted Bitcoin? Frankfurt’s Bankhaus Scheich has a budding business cleaning crypto and getting it back into circulation.

contentList.title: Effective Altruism-Linked Group Used Millions Donated By FTX To Buy A Czech Castle
contentList.description: Collapsed crypto exchange FTX's bankruptcy proceedings could endanger some of founder Sam Bankman-Fried’s philanthropic gifts — like the one an effective altruism-aligned group used to buy a castle in Czechia.

contentList.title: Binance’s Asset Shuffling Eerily Similar To Maneuvers By FTX
contentList.description: When you’re the world’s largest crypto exchange in a largely unregulated market, it is easy to make up the rules as you go.

contentList.title: These Companies Say They Can Recover Stolen Crypto. That Rarely Happens.
contentList.description: After being scammed for over $500,000, one man paid one such company $6,500 to recover his stolen savings. A year later, he’s received nothing — and he’s not alone.

contentList.title: Reddit Co-Founder’s Quest For Unseizable Property
contentList.description: Alexis Ohanian’s ancestors perished during the Armenian genocide and had their assets seized. That generational trauma is a big reason why he’s betting heavily on NFTs and future social networks, despite crypto’s chilly winter storm.

contentList.title: How Mastercard, Goldman Sachs And Other “TradFi” Titans Are Using Blockchain To Rewire Global Finance
contentList.description: Crypto is in crisis, but many of the world’s biggest financial institutions are still banking on the underlying tech as the best way to build confidence with customers—and with one another.

contentList.title: Exclusive: Sam Bankman-Fried Recalls His Hellish Week In A Caribbean Prison
contentList.description: Tiny towels and stale Wonder Bread were a bother, but for the former FTX chief, jail time in the Bahamas was unbearable because he was offline. Forbes spent a day with the accused former billionaire, under house arrest in his parents California home.

contentList.title: With A New CEO, An Adult Has Arrived To Clean Up The FTX Mess
contentList.description: John J. Ray III, a veteran of Enron, Fruit of the Loom and other bankruptcies, now must pick up the shattered pieces from Sam Bankman-Fried’s chaotic reign.

contentList.title: Billionaire Adoption Rate Of Crypto Nearly Double Average
contentList.description: A recent survey by Forbes of 65 of the world’s wealthiest people revealed that nearly 30% are either directly or indirectly invested in cryptocurrencies, a rate that is higher than among non-billionaire investors.

contentList.title: Will Ether ETFs Revitalize Crypto? (June Issue)
contentList.description: Ether ETFs are on their way. Read inside to learn what it means for this current market slump. Plus check out the newest picks for the stock and crypto portfolios.

contentList.title: What If The SEC Is Not A Monster? (May Issue)
contentList.description: Congress is finally making progress towards passing crypto regulation. But at the same time it is important to remember that the SEC is not the monster that it is made out to be in this industry.

contentList.title: Taking Stock Of Crypto Post-Bitcoin Halving (April Issue)
contentList.description: As Bitcoin moves past its halving, all eyes are on whether developers can build a new infrastructure on top of the $1 trillion network.

contentList.title: The Rise Of Crypto Zombies (March Issue)
contentList.description: Forbes published a groundbreaking study exposing 20 billion-dollar blockchains with little actual use. Get details inside. Plus, Solana soars on memecoin mania while mining stocks struggle before the halving.

contentList.title: Sticky Questions Surrounding The Spot Ether ETF (February Issue)
contentList.description: Bitcoin just pumped past $60,000 as ETF adoption continues to grow. Here's what you should expect next along with spotlights on a number of new projects that could shine during the next bull market.

contentList.title: Feeling Just Fine At $50,000
contentList.description: Yesterday bitcoin crossed the $50,000 mark for the first time since 2021.

contentList.title: Getting Closer To An Ether ETF?
contentList.description: Bitcoin and ether picked up this week, and MicroStrategy makes a bold claim.

contentList.title: Powell Says The Quiet Part Out Loud
contentList.description: Jay Powell says that the Fed is going to take its time before starting rate cuts in 2024.

contentList.title: Bitcoin ETFs Are Up And Running (January Issue)
contentList.description: Spot bitcoin ETFs are finally here. Though they did not push bitcoin to new heights just yet, better days are ahead.

contentList.title: Q&A With Andreessen Horowitz's Chris Dixon
contentList.description: I spoke with famed crypto venture capitalist Chris Dixon to discuss his new book and get into the details or core questions that will define the future of the industry.

contentList.title: And They're Off!
contentList.description: 11 bitcoin ETFs started trading today, and the action was pretty brisk.

contentList.title: Start Your ETF Engines
contentList.description: Spot bitcoin ETFs are almost ready. Here is what you need to know to get started.

contentList.title: A Better Crypto World In 2024? (December Issue)
contentList.description: As we roll into 2024, crypto looks to turn the page on the era of Sam Bankman-Fried and Changpeng Zhao. Look inside to see what it means for investors.

contentList.title: Q&A With CoinTracker Head Of Tax Strategy Shehan Chandrasekera
contentList.description: Here is everything that you need to know about how end of year crypto trading activity will impact 2023 tax obligations.

contentList.title: SOL And Steady Wins The Race
contentList.description: Solana ecosystem tokens are surging, but that does not mean that you should dive in.
